Af.name: Tropical Rainforest Climate
Af.desc: Hot and humid year-round with significant rainfall every month. No dry season. Typical of the Amazon Basin and Congo Basin.

Am.name: Tropical Monsoon Climate
Am.desc: Hot year-round with a short dry season, but heavy monsoon rains compensate for it. Found in parts of India, Southeast Asia, and West Africa.

Aw.name: Tropical Savanna Climate
Aw.desc: Hot year-round with distinct wet and dry seasons. Dry season occurs in winter. Typical of savannas in Africa, South America, and northern Australia.

BWh.name: Hot Desert Climate
BWh.desc: Extremely arid with very little rainfall and hot temperatures year-round. Found in the Sahara, Arabian, and Australian deserts.

BWk.name: Cold Desert Climate
BWk.desc: Arid climate with cold winters. Found in the Gobi Desert, Great Basin, and Patagonian Desert.

BSh.name: Hot Semi-Arid Climate
BSh.desc: Semi-arid steppe climate with hot temperatures. More rainfall than deserts but still dry. Found in the Sahel and parts of the Middle East.

BSk.name: Cold Semi-Arid Climate
BSk.desc: Semi-arid steppe climate with cold winters. Found in the Great Plains, Central Asia, and inland areas of western North America.

Csa.name: Hot-Summer Mediterranean Climate
Csa.desc: Warm to hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. Classic Mediterranean climate found around the Mediterranean Sea, California, and parts of Chile and Australia.

Csb.name: Warm-Summer Mediterranean Climate
Csb.desc: Warm, dry summers and cool, wet winters. Found in coastal California, coastal Chile, and parts of southern Australia.

Csc.name: Cold-Summer Mediterranean Climate
Csc.desc: Cool, dry summers and cold, wet winters. Rare climate found in high-elevation areas with Mediterranean precipitation patterns.

Cfa.name: Humid Subtropical Climate
Cfa.desc: Hot, humid summers and mild winters with rainfall year-round. Found in the southeastern United States, eastern China, and parts of South America.

Cfb.name: Oceanic Climate
Cfb.desc: Mild temperatures year-round with regular rainfall in all seasons. Found in Western Europe, New Zealand, and the Pacific Northwest.

Cfc.name: Subpolar Oceanic Climate
Cfc.desc: Cool summers and cold winters with year-round precipitation. Found in Iceland, southern Alaska, and southern Chile.

Cwa.name: Monsoon-Influenced Humid Subtropical Climate
Cwa.desc: Hot summers with dry winters. Found in parts of northern India, southern China, and the African highlands.

Cwb.name: Subtropical Highland Climate
Cwb.desc: Warm summers and mild winters with a dry winter season. Found in high-elevation tropical and subtropical areas like the East African highlands.

Cwc.name: Cold Subtropical Highland Climate
Cwc.desc: Cool summers and cold winters with dry winters. Found in very high elevation tropical areas.

Dfa.name: Hot-Summer Humid Continental Climate
Dfa.desc: Hot summers and cold winters with precipitation year-round. Found in the northern United States and southern Canada.

Dfb.name: Warm-Summer Humid Continental Climate
Dfb.desc: Warm summers and very cold winters with year-round precipitation. Found in northern United States, central Canada, and northern Europe.

Dfc.name: Subarctic Climate
Dfc.desc: Short, cool summers and long, very cold winters with year-round precipitation. Found in Siberia, northern Canada, and Alaska.

Dwa.name: Monsoon-Influenced Hot-Summer Continental Climate
Dwa.desc: Hot summers and cold, dry winters. Found in northern China and Korea.

Dwb.name: Monsoon-Influenced Warm-Summer Continental Climate
Dwb.desc: Warm summers and very cold, dry winters. Found in parts of northeastern China and Mongolia.

Dwc.name: Monsoon-Influenced Subarctic Climate
Dwc.desc: Cool summers and extremely cold, dry winters. Found in eastern Siberia.

Dsa.name: Mediterranean-Influenced Hot-Summer Continental Climate
Dsa.desc: Hot, dry summers and cold winters. Rare climate found in parts of Turkey and Iran.

Dsb.name: Mediterranean-Influenced Warm-Summer Continental Climate
Dsb.desc: Warm, dry summers and cold winters. Found in parts of interior western United States and central Asia.

Dsc.name: Mediterranean-Influenced Subarctic Climate
Dsc.desc: Cool, dry summers and very cold winters. Rare climate found in small areas of interior Alaska and Asia.

ET.name: Tundra Climate
ET.desc: At least one month above freezing but no month above 10Â°C. Found in northern Canada, Alaska, northern Russia, and Antarctica coasts.

EF.name: Ice Cap Climate
EF.desc: All months below freezing with permanent ice cover. Found in Antarctica, Greenland interior, and high Arctic islands.
